title: Why is climate 'doomism' going viral – and who's fighting it?
description: Climate "doomers" believe it’s far too late to do anything about climate change - but they're wrong.

title: 'I was repeatedly ignored' - report finds maternity racism
description: The charity Birthrights conducted a year-long investigation into "racial injustice" in maternity care.

title: Palm oil firms depriving tribes of millions of dollars
description: Companies supplying major manufacturers fail to meet promises to share land, joint BBC investigation finds.

title: Spaghetti Junction at 50: What lies beneath?
description: Images capture life below one of the UK's best known road structures on eve of its 50th birthday.

title: The sci-fi technology tackling malarial mosquitos
description: Gene drive development makes a genetically modified gene that spreads widely within populations.

title: Match of the Day analysis: How Ilkay Gundogan won the Premier League for Manchester City
description: Match of the Day pundits Ian Wright and Alan Shearer analyse Manchester City's stunning late comeback to win the Premier League title, highlighting the performance of Ilkay Gundogan, who scored two goals off the bench.

title: Colonel in Iran Revolutionary Guards assassinated
description: Sayad Khodai, a senior figure in the elite Quds force, was reportedly shot dead in his car by two gunmen.

title: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola says champions are 'legends'
description: Manchester City's manager says his side "are legends" after securing their fourth Premier League title in five seasons.

title: Ukraine peace deal: Kyiv rules out ceding land to Russia
description: Zelensky adviser says Kyiv will not agree a peace deal with Russia that involves giving up territory.

title: Pampered pooches ride Japan's Shinkansen in style
description: Paws aboard! A pet-friendly service premiers on the iconic train as calls grow for easier pet travel.

title: Harry Kane: Exhibition to explore England captain's rise to the top
description: The England captain's golden boot and his MBE are among the items on display.

title: Professor Brian Cox: Maybe humans are the Martians
description: The renowned physicist reflects on whether civilisation, like us, exists in other galaxies.

title: Manchester Arena attack: Events mark fifth anniversary
description: Survivor Freya Lewis will start the Great Manchester Run as events mark the attack which killed 22 people.

title: 'Welcome to Luton' stunt panics Gatwick Airport arrivals
description: YouTuber, Max Fosh, says the "prank" is to put smiles on faces and is sorry for any confusion caused.

title: Afghanistan's female TV presenters cover their faces
description: A day after defying a Taliban order, women on TV fell in line with face-covering veils.

title: Deadline approaches for officials set to be named by Sue Gray
description: Those expected to be identified in the report on No 10 gatherings have until Sunday afternoon to respond.

title: Monkeypox: Israel and Switzerland confirm cases
description: It means the viral outbreak has spread to 14 countries with more than 80 cases detected so far.

title: World Rugby Sevens: England and Argentina criticised over two-minute try
description: England and Argentina are criticised over a long delay before scoring a try that helps both sides progress from their World Rugby Sevens men's group in Toulouse.

title: Floods in Bangladesh and India affect millions
description: At least 50 people are dead after some areas are battered by widespread flooding and landslides.

title: Australia election: Anthony Albanese signals climate policy change
description: Anthony Albanese vows to take the nation in a new direction, creating a renewable energy superpower.

title: Australia election: A great shock to the system
description: Politics will now be greener, more feminine, and more emphatically Australian, writes Nick Bryant.

title: UK charities call for menstrual leave for severe pain
description: It comes after a draft bill was approved in Spanish parliament to allow three days of leave a month.

title: Ukraine war: Against the thud of artillery, miners struggle on
description: Miners in eastern Ukraine on how a difficult job has become even more dangerous.

title: The Papers: PM 'to sacrifice top official' and free tuition plan
description: The expected fallout from the Sue Gray report and plans to provide tuition to every pupil in need lead the papers.

title: The Hacienda rises again: The Manchester nightclub raves on after 40 years
description: Forty years after it opened, the legendary nightclub is credited with changing music and Manchester.

title: Future foods: What you could be eating by 2050
description: Scientists say we need to future-proof our diets in a warming world by eating little-known plants.

title: Governments should subsidise food and energy, says IMF boss
description: Managing director Kristalina Georgieva says state subsidies can help with the cost of living.

title: 'How the state tried to silence my abusive agent expose'
description: BBC News reporter Daniel De Simone on his courtroom fight to reveal how an MI5 agent abused women.

title: Social media: Did the pandemic poison online politics?
description: As the UK spent countless hours online during lockdown, how much has it changed us?

title: 'My first court case: Prosecuting my father's killers'
description: Shagufta Ahmed's first job was to get justice for her father, a lecturer murdered after he blew the whistle on a colleague.

title: ‘I’m a Rasta, I’m British, I’m an officer and a commando’
description: Capt Kidane Cousland is helping ensure Rastafarians can express their faith while serving in the military.
